biogHist.abstract: Brigitte Williams was a once only candidate who represented the Australian Democrats in the 1999 elections for the New South Wales Legislative Assembly seat of Oxley. She believes in community action and is active in Landcare and the local Catchment Management Committee. Brigitte has worked in the hospitality industry in managing positions in a hotel and a caravan park (1980-82). She then managed a market garden and was Secretary for the Bellinger River Action Group (1984-94) while completing her tertiary qualifications (B.A., Dip. Ed.). She has taught English and History at tertiary and secondary level, and by correspondence.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Williams, Brigitte', in The Australian Women's Register, National Foundation for Australian Women and The University of Melbourne
Site Exhibition: Putting Skirts on the Sacred Benches: Women Candidates for the New South Wales Parliament

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Julie Williams interviewed by Ros Bowden in the Women of the land oral history project

archref.repository: National Library of Australia, Oral History and Folklore Collection
archref.unittitle: Julie Williams interviewed by Ros Bowden in the Women of the land oral history project
archref.abstract: Williams, a dairy hand and agriculturalist, speaks of growing up in Warrnambool, Vic., her dairy farming background, her qualifications and experience in agriculture, marrying a stockman and starting a family, her current involvement in a Dept. of Agriculture dairy farm management and lifeskills project (partly an extension of the Target Ten Project pasture management courses), her use of leadership skills training, her interest in travelling and meeting Recorded in 1995.
